item.description:
Worcester Alliance of Photographers Monthly Meetup

Our gatherings begin at 7:30 PM the Last Thursday of every month.

 

Basic outline of the evening - from 7:30 to 8:00 will be open and social. Hanging out chit chatting will be encouraged!

 

The from 8:00 to 9:00 we will have a more organized agenda. A topic, a presentation, a group sharing of images, something related to Photography!

 

This months topic: To "steal" an idea or to "not steal" an idea?

While trolling on Facebook I came across a post from a friend that was complaining about people stealing her ideas. I think this is a great topic for our next meetup. Why?

1. Did you know that copyright law does not extend to "ideas."

For example, in one case, a federal court ruled that a Kate Spade advertisement showing "a woman's feet, astride a toilet, in stylish, colorful shoes, with a handbag on the floor," merely embodied "an idea that has been used often in popular culture." Talented but out-of-luck fashion photographer Bill Diodato's earlier, unmistakably similar photo, failed to persuade the court that any legal wrong needed right-ing.

More recently, another talented fashion photographer, David LaChapelle, sued Rihanna for similarities between the music video for her song "S&M" and an earlier series of S&M-themed photos by LaChapelle.

It seems fairly obvious in both the Kate Spade and the Rihanna cases that the second work was indeed "derived" from the first (to use LaChapelle's term.)  But if the only thing copied was an idea, that "derivation" may not matter, since -- once again -- you can't copyright ideas. (want to read this whole post? http://www.avvo.com/legal-guides/ugc/how-can-i-keep-other-people-from-stealing-my-idea)

2. “Does Imitation Breed Innovation?”
http://www.photographyblackwhite.com/steal-idea/

I think - yes! Of course it does! What do you think?

Should you never look at another persons work out of fear of being "influenced"? But what do you think? Where is the line for you?

3. Please steal my ideas... Read this article: http://evie-s.com/news/2011/05/21/please-steal-my-ideas/

I agree with her about art being generous. And authentic. Do it better, do it great. Let's hear your thoughts...

 



Then from 9 to 9:30 We will hang out again catching up with folks from that evenings topic. We'll clean up and head out by 9:45.

 

We will be asking for a donation at the meetups of $5.00 to cover costs. However it's not mandatory to attend - just please donate if you can...

 

[:D] Cheers,

 

Donna & Scotty
item.how_to_find_us: First floor at Visions By Baker studio

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: The Worcester Alliance of Photographers Monthly Meetup Group
